speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in a castle.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Enter HUBERT and Executioners

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Heat me these irons hot; and look thou stand

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Within the arras: when I strike my foot

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Upon the bosom of the ground, rush forth,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And bind the boy which you shall find with me

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Fast to the chair: be heedful: hence, and watch.

speaker: First Executioner
text_entry: I hope your warrant will bear out the deed.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Uncleanly scruples! fear not you: look to't.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Exeunt Executioners

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Young lad, come forth; I have to say with you.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Enter ARTHUR

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Good morrow, Hubert.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Good morrow, little prince.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: As little prince, having so great a title

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: To be more prince, as may be. You are sad.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Indeed, I have been merrier.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Mercy on me!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Methinks no body should be sad but I:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Yet, I remember, when I was in France,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Young gentlemen would be as sad as night,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Only for wantonness. By my christendom,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: So I were out of prison and kept sheep,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I should be as merry as the day is long;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And so I would be here, but that I doubt

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: My uncle practises more harm to me:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: He is afraid of me and I of him:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Is it my fault that I was Geffrey's son?

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: No, indeed, is't not; and I would to heaven

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I were your son, so you would love me, Hubert.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: [Aside]  If I talk to him, with his innocent prate

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: He will awake my mercy which lies dead:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Therefore I will be sudden and dispatch.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Are you sick, Hubert? you look pale to-day:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: In sooth, I would you were a little sick,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: That I might sit all night and watch with you:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I warrant I love you more than you do me.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: [Aside]  His words do take possession of my bosom.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Read here, young Arthur.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Showing a paper

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Aside

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: How now, foolish rheum!

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Turning dispiteous torture out of door!

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I must be brief, lest resolution drop

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Out at mine eyes in tender womanish tears.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Can you not read it? Is it not fair writ?

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Too fairly, Hubert, for so foul effect:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Must you with hot irons burn out both mine eyes?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Young boy, I must.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And will you?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And I will.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Have you the heart? When your head did but ache,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I knit my handercher about your brows,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: The best I had, a princess wrought it me,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And I did never ask it you again;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And with my hand at midnight held your head,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And like the watchful minutes to the hour,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Still and anon cheer'd up the heavy time,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Saying, 'What lack you?' and 'Where lies your grief?'

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Or 'What good love may I perform for you?'

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Many a poor man's son would have lien still

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And ne'er have spoke a loving word to you;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: But you at your sick service had a prince.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Nay, you may think my love was crafty love

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And call it cunning: do, an if you will:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: If heaven be pleased that you must use me ill,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Why then you must. Will you put out mine eyes?

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: These eyes that never did nor never shall

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: So much as frown on you.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I have sworn to do it;

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And with hot irons must I burn them out.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Ah, none but in this iron age would do it!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: The iron of itself, though heat red-hot,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Approaching near these eyes, would drink my tears

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And quench his fiery indignation

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Even in the matter of mine innocence;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Nay, after that, consume away in rust

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: But for containing fire to harm mine eye.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Are you more stubborn-hard than hammer'd iron?

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: An if an angel should have come to me

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And told me Hubert should put out mine eyes,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I would not have believed him,--no tongue but Hubert's.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Come forth.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Stamps

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Re-enter Executioners, with a cord, irons,  and c

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Do as I bid you do.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: O, save me, Hubert, save me! my eyes are out

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Even with the fierce looks of these bloody men.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Give me the iron, I say, and bind him here.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Alas, what need you be so boisterous-rough?

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I will not struggle, I will stand stone-still.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: For heaven sake, Hubert, let me not be bound!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Nay, hear me, Hubert, drive these men away,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And I will sit as quiet as a lamb;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I will not stir, nor wince, nor speak a word,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Nor look upon the iron angerly:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Thrust but these men away, and I'll forgive you,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Whatever torment you do put me to.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Go, stand within; let me alone with him.

speaker: First Executioner
text_entry: I am best pleased to be from such a deed.

speaker: First Executioner
text_entry: Exeunt Executioners

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Alas, I then have chid away my friend!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: He hath a stern look, but a gentle heart:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Let him come back, that his compassion may

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Give life to yours.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Come, boy, prepare yourself.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Is there no remedy?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: None, but to lose your eyes.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: O heaven, that there were but a mote in yours,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: A grain, a dust, a gnat, a wandering hair,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Any annoyance in that precious sense!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Then feeling what small things are boisterous there,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Your vile intent must needs seem horrible.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Is this your promise? go to, hold your tongue.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Hubert, the utterance of a brace of tongues

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Must needs want pleading for a pair of eyes:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Let me not hold my tongue, let me not, Hubert;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Or, Hubert, if you will, cut out my tongue,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: So I may keep mine eyes: O, spare mine eyes.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Though to no use but still to look on you!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Lo, by my truth, the instrument is cold

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And would not harm me.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I can heat it, boy.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: No, in good sooth: the fire is dead with grief,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Being create for comfort, to be used

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: In undeserved extremes: see else yourself;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: There is no malice in this burning coal;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: The breath of heaven has blown his spirit out

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And strew'd repentent ashes on his head.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: But with my breath I can revive it, boy.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: An if you do, you will but make it blush

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And glow with shame of your proceedings, Hubert:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Nay, it perchance will sparkle in your eyes;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And like a dog that is compell'd to fight,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Snatch at his master that doth tarre him on.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: All things that you should use to do me wrong

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Deny their office: only you do lack

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: That mercy which fierce fire and iron extends,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Creatures of note for mercy-lacking uses.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Well, see to live; I will not touch thine eye

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: For all the treasure that thine uncle owes:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Yet am I sworn and I did purpose, boy,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: With this same very iron to burn them out.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: O, now you look like Hubert! all this while

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: You were disguised.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Peace; no more. Adieu.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Your uncle must not know but you are dead;

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I'll fill these dogged spies with false reports:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And, pretty child, sleep doubtless and secure,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: That Hubert, for the wealth of all the world,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Will not offend thee.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: O heaven! I thank you, Hubert.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Silence; no more: go closely in with me:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Much danger do I undergo for thee.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Exeunt
